Pre-Game Insights: The Dallas Mavericks host the Portland Trail Blazers in Western Conference play on January 10, 2025.
The Mavericks are 15-13 against Western Conference opponents and 2-4 in games decided by 3 points or fewer.
The Trail Blazers are 11-20 against Western Conference opponents and have a 4-3 record in games decided by less than 4 points.
The Mavericks average 116.4 points per game, equal to what the Trail Blazers give up.
The Trail Blazers average 108.4 points per game, 3.5 fewer than the 111.9 the Mavericks give up to opponents.
P.J. Washington is scoring 13.1 points per game and averaging 7.5 rebounds for the Mavericks.
Anfernee Simons is averaging 18.5 points and 5.1 assists for the Trail Blazers.

In their last 10 games, the Mavericks have a 4-6 record, averaging 110.7 points, 42.9 rebounds, 23.0 assists, 7.4 steals, and 6.9 blocks per game while shooting 46.3% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 109.5 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Trail Blazers have a 5-5 record, averaging 112.4 points, 44.2 rebounds, 25.0 assists, 7.7 steals, and 4.8 blocks per game while shooting 48.6% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 117.1 points.
Injuries for the Mavericks include Daniel Gafford (day to day, ankle), Dante Exum (out, wrist), Luka Doncic (out, calf), and Kyrie Irving (out, illness).
Injuries for the Trail Blazers include Matisse Thybulle (day to day, ankle), Donovan Clingan (day to day, rest), and Jerami Grant (day to day, face).
